result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad Christopher Headley

records.addlTxt: THIS CASE HAS BEEN ADMINISTRATIVELY TRANSFERRED TO JUDGE ANNETTE BARNA AS JUDGE STEVE ANDERSON HAS RETIRED.
Jury trial on December 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

4:00 PM Defendant Chad Christopher Headley appeared by video.  Attorney Laura Ann Sutton appeared by video for Chad Christopher Headley. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin.  Judge Steven Anderson appears by video from Rusk County.   Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Sutton request case be set for trial.   Court sets.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Final pre-trial on November 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Review hearing on June 30, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

NO CONTACT WITH:  T.D.J. (dob: 11/29/1980).  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption controlled substances, prescriptions that have not been prescribed, or any substance to alter mental state or mood.  May not possess drug paraphernalia.  If prescribed, prescriptions must be taken as DR ordered.   
Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

10: 30 AM Judge Steven Anderson appears by video from Rusk County Defendant Chad Christopher Headley appeared by video. Attorney Laura Ann Sutton appeared by video for Chad Christopher Headley. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case (22CM09, 22TR27, 21CF165, 21CM107, 22CM07, 21TR347, 22CM08, 22CF133, 21CF380, 22CF24) and recites appearances. 

22CF133 - Atty Sutton indicates she has not reviewed criminal complaint with DEF, requesting to hold the INIT at the end of today's hearings to allow her time to opt-in and review criminal complaint.  

22CF24 - State indicates ready to proceed and has one witness for the preliminary hearing.  10:32AM State calls Deputy Craig Depew.  Clerk swears in witness.  State questions witness.  10:43AM Witness identifies DEF. 10:44AM  Atty Sutton cross examines witness. 10:47 Atty Sutton concludes questioning.  State had no redirect.  State has no additional witnesses.  Atty Sutton has no witnesses.  State makes argument, requests bind over.  Atty Sutton has no argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.  Court indicates bond incorrectly lists no contact with TDA, should be TDJ.  Court indicates no objections by either party to correct.  Atty Sutton indicates no objection to bond correction.

10:50AM Atty Sutton requests breakout room with DEF.  OFF THE RECORD at 10:50AM

10:54AM BACK ON THE RECORD / Appearances remain unchanged.  22CF133 -- Atty Sutton indicates waiver of formal reading, requests preliminary hearing on felony bail jump, waiving time limits.  DEF agrees.  Court finds DEF knowingly, intelligently, freely, and voluntarily waives time limits.    

Atty Sutton requests PLEAH set for all cases.  State has no objection.  Court indicates his JA will contact parties to schedule a review hearing.  DEF questions Court on signing bond, Clerk indicates bond will be held at COC window for DEF to sign.  State requests clarification on 21CM326 and 20CM323, Court indicates he will have is JA contact Washburn County.

NO CONTACT WITH:  T.D.A. (dob: 11/29/1980).  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption controlled substances, prescriptions that have not been prescribed, or any substance to alter mental state or mood.  May not possess drug paraphernalia.  If prescribed, prescriptions must be taken as DR ordered.   
Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
Letter sent to DEF with bond, requesting signature and bond return.
Preliminary hearing on May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.

NO CONTACT WITH:  T.D.A. (dob: 11/29/1980).  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption controlled substances, prescriptions that have not been prescribed, or any substance to alter mental state or mood.  May not possess drug paraphernalia.  If prescribed, prescriptions must be taken as DR ordered.   
Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

9:04 AM Judge Steven Anderson appears by video from Rusk County.  Defendant Chad Christopher Headley appeared by video, with Attorney Laura Ann Sutton. Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases (21CM107, 21CF165, 22CM08, 22CF24, 22TR27, 21TR347, 22CM07, 22CM09, 21CF380) and recites appearances. 

Court indicates the following hearings are needed:  INIT in 22CM07, 22CM08, 22CF24, 22CM09 / Preliminary hearing in 21CF380 / STC in 21CM107, 21CF165, 22TR27, 21TR347.  

All parties ready to proceed with initial appearances.  Regarding cases 22CM07, 22CM08, 22CF24, 22CM09, Atty Sutton indicates defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, enters NG pleas on behalf of DEF.  Atty Sutton requests preliminary hearing in 22CF24, indicates DEF is ready to proceed with  prelim in 21CF380.  

State indicates bonds needed in 22CM07, 22CM08, 22CF24, 21CF380 and that bond has been set in 22CM09.  State makes bond recommendations in  22CM07, 22CM08, and 21CF380.   Atty Sutton has no objections, Court sets bonds.  

State makes bond recommendation in 22CF24.  Atty Sutton has no objection.  Court sets bond.  Atty Sutton requests prelim within 20 days.  Discussion among all parties on scheduling.  Court sets PH for 5/23/22 at 10:30AM

Regarding 21CF380, all parties are ready to proceed with preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing completed for 21CF380.  

Court sets PH for 22CF24 / ARGN for 21CF380 / STC for 21CM107, 21CF165, 22CM08, 22TR27, 21TR347, 22CM07, 22CM09 for 5/23/22 at 10:30AM so cases will continue to track together.  


COURT:

SIBS $5000.  NO CONTACT WITH:  T.D.A. (dob: 11/29/1980).  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption controlled substances, prescriptions that have not been prescribed, or any substance to alter mental state or mood.  May not possess drug paraphernalia.  If prescribed, prescriptions must be taken as DR ordered.   
Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.

Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 10:30 am.
